summary: Fitness app with exercise management functionality. Currently investigating a bug where the Manage Exercise page shows a perpetual spinning orange wheel and the 'Add Exercise' button is unresponsive after a recent deployment.
architectural_notes: App uses Internet Computer canisters for backend data storage and retrieval
Frontend assets (images like goatbuff.png) should be placed in frontend/public/ folder
known_issues: Manage Exercise page shows perpetual spinning orange wheel after login; Add Exercise button unresponsive â€” likely broken canister query/update call

existing_features.title: Investigate and fix the ExerciseLibrary page so it no longer shows a perpetual spinning orange loading indicator after a user logs in. The page should resolve its loading state and render the exercise list (or an empty state) once the backend query completes or errors.

Investigate and fix the 'Add Exercise' button on the Exercise Library page so it responds to user clicks and opens the Add Exercise dialog/form. The button must be functional after the user is authenticated.

Audit the useQueries.ts hooks related to exercise fetching and mutation (getExercises, addExercise, etc.) to ensure actor initialization is awaited correctly before making canister calls, and that query/mutation error states are properly surfaced rather than silently hanging.

projectName: Fix perpetual spinner and broken Add Exercise functionality on Manage Exercise page
